definitions.definition: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

examples.text: the emission of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere

definitions.definition: gas, etc. that is sent out into the air
definitions.labels: (especially British English)(especially North American English)(North American English)

examples.text: The government has pledged to clean up industrial emissions.
We must take action to cut vehicle emissions.
measures to reduce harmful emissions from traffic
the Kyoto protocol on cutting greenhouse gas emissions

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘emanation’): from Latin emissio(n-), from emiss- ‘sent out’, from the verb emittere, from e- (variant of ex-) ‘out of’ + mittere ‘send’.
